Boston police detective charged with domestic violence

 

Wednesday

Feb 6, 2008 at 12:01 AM Feb 6, 2008 at 6:14 AM


A Boston police detective assigned to the domestic violence unit was charged with assaulting his girlfriend at his Randolph home.


Detective Windell Josey, 50, pleaded innocent to charges of domestic assault and battery and intimidation of a witness at an arraignment in Quincy District Court on Tuesday. He was released on personal recognizance.


His girlfriend has obtained an emergency restraining order against him, and his personal firearms were turned over to Randolph police.


The Boston Herald reported that Boston Police Commissioner Ed Davis immediately placed Josey on administrative leave. Josey turned in his department-issued firearm.


Police said the incident took place at about 12:30 p.m. Monday at Josey’s home.


Police received a 911 call from the home that was disconnected. A second 911 call, on a cell phone to State Police, was transferred to Randolph. The first call was disconnected after the phone wire was ripped out, police said.
